graph.original_query: What was the AQI of Kolkata on 22nd December 2025?

globals_schema.formatted_aqi_report_T004:
Kolkata Air Quality Analysis - 2025-12-22

1. Executive Summary

Unfortunately, the Air Quality Index (AQI) data for Kolkata on December 22nd, 2025 is currently unavailable. This report is based on limited information and requires further revision upon data availability.

2. Data Acquisition Issues

Initial attempts to retrieve the AQI data from primary sources were unsuccessful. This may be due to server errors, network issues, or data reporting inconsistencies.

3. Sources Consulted

  • https://www.aqi.in/in/dashboard/india/west-bengal/kolkata/historical-analysis - Error encountered during data retrieval.
  • https://airquality.cpcb.gov.in/AQI_India/ - National Air Quality Index - Data retrieval successful, but specific AQI data for the specified date was not readily available.
  • https://ews.tropmet.res.in/kolkata/index.php - Kolkata - Air Quality Early Warning System - Data available, but only for 2025-12-23.
  • https://breathe.climate.uchicago.edu/kolkata-india/ - Chicago University Breathe Project - General information and news articles available, but no specific daily AQI for 2025-12-22.
  • https://www.iqair.com/af/india/west-bengal/kolkata - IQAir - Data available for 2025-12-23.

4. Preliminary Findings (2025-12-23 Data)

While the specific data for December 22nd is unavailable, data from December 23rd, 2025 (obtained from IQAir) indicates:

  • US AQI: 219 (Very Unhealthy)
  • Main Pollutant: PM2.5 (144 g/m³)

5. Air Quality Forecast (IQAir - 2025-12-23)

IQAir provides the following forecast for Kolkata:

Time AQI PM2.5 (µg/m³)
Now 219 144
12:30 209 21
13:30 205 23
14:30 197 25

6. Recent News on Kolkata Air Quality

According to the University of Chicago Breathe project, recent news articles indicate:

  • Aug 25, 2025: Kolkata beats other metros, reports more than 50% of good air days in 4 years (Source: Times of India)
  • Aug 25, 2025: Surge in lung ailments in Kolkata as vehicle emissions choke city (Source: Down to Earth)
  • Aug 25, 2025: PM 2.5 in 2024-25 winter Kolkatas best since 2019 (Source: Times of India)
  • Aug 26, 2025: Kolkata study finds air toxicity surges when PM2.5 breaches 70 g/m (Source: Unknown)
  • Aug 27, 2025: Kolkata has second worst air among Indias metros (Source: Telegraph India)
  • Aug 27, 2025: How Kolkata improved its air quality within 6 years (Source: The Indian Express)

7. Health Recommendations (Based on Current AQI)

Given the "Very Unhealthy" AQI level (based on 2025-12-23 data):

  • Avoid outdoor exercise.
  • Close windows to avoid dirty outdoor air.
  • Consider wearing a mask outdoors.
  • Use an air purifier.

8. QA Verdict

This report requires revision as the data for 2025-12-22 is unavailable. (Verdict: needs_revision)

9. Conclusion

The AQI data for Kolkata on December 22nd, 2025 is currently unavailable. Further investigation and data retrieval are required to provide an accurate and complete assessment.
globals_schema.formatted_aqi_report_retry_T009F1:
Kolkata Air Quality Report - December 22, 2025

1. Introduction

This report provides an analysis of the Air Quality Index (AQI) for Kolkata on December 22, 2025. Due to initial data retrieval issues, a re-attempt was made to obtain the necessary information. This report includes the re-extracted AQI value and the associated QA verdict.

2. Data Sources

The primary data source for AQI information is the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) and other reputable air quality monitoring websites. Specific sources consulted include:

  • https://www.aqi.in/in/dashboard/india/west-bengal/kolkata/historical-analysis
  • https://airquality.cpcb.gov.in/AQI_India/
  • https://ews.tropmet.res.in/kolkata/index.php
  • https://breathe.climate.uchicago.edu/kolkata-india/
  • https://www.iqair.com/af/india/west-bengal/kolkata

3. AQI Value for December 22, 2025

Unfortunately, after multiple attempts, a specific AQI value for Kolkata on December 22, 2025, could not be reliably extracted. This is indicated by the missing `kolkata_aqi_20251222_retry_T007F1` value. The initial data retrieval also faced similar issues (refer to `kolkata_aqi_20251222_T002`).

4. QA Verdict

The QA verdict for the initial attempt was `needs_revision` (as indicated by `qa_verdict_T003`). Since a reliable AQI value was still unavailable after the retry, the QA verdict for the retry is also likely to be negative, although the specific `qa_verdict_retry_T008F1` value is also missing, further confirming the data retrieval failure.

5. Possible Reasons for Data Unavailability

Several factors may contribute to the unavailability of the AQI data:

  • Data Reporting Delays: AQI data might not be immediately available on the specified date due to reporting delays from monitoring stations.
  • Website or API Issues: The data source websites or APIs could be experiencing technical difficulties or maintenance.
  • Data Inconsistencies: Variations in data collection and reporting methodologies across different sources can lead to inconsistencies.
  • Network Errors: Transient network errors during data retrieval could have prevented successful data extraction.

6. Related Air Quality Information (If Available)

Due to the unavailability of specific AQI data for the target date, related information from nearby dates or general trends could be relevant. However, without the actual value, providing specifics is impossible. Refer to the linked sources for potential alternative data points.

7. Health Implications (General Guidance)

While the specific AQI value is unavailable, it's important to be aware of the general health implications of air pollution. High AQI levels can cause respiratory problems, cardiovascular issues, and other adverse health effects. Individuals with pre-existing conditions, children, and the elderly are particularly vulnerable.

8. Recommendations

Based on the data retrieval failures, the following recommendations are made:

  • Re-attempt Data Retrieval: Try to retrieve the AQI data again after a few hours or days to account for potential reporting delays.
  • Consult Multiple Sources: Verify the data from different sources to ensure consistency and accuracy.
  • Consider Historical Data: Analyze historical AQI data for Kolkata to understand typical air quality patterns during December.
  • Implement Data Validation: Implement robust data validation procedures to identify and handle missing or invalid data.

9. Conclusion

Despite multiple attempts, a reliable AQI value for Kolkata on December 22, 2025, could not be obtained. This highlights the challenges associated with real-time data retrieval and the importance of robust data validation processes. Further investigation and monitoring are required to provide a comprehensive assessment of air quality in Kolkata on the specified date.
